metadata.synopsis: Locke and Marrick are parents who are scared for their daughter Arabella. Taken by the druids, Arabella is appearing in court on accusations of thievery. Her parents have no doubt that she is guilty but they are terrified for her and trying to get to her.Marrick hides his concern throughout with anger and threats of violence. It is easier to deal with fury then it is to temper fear. Locke is more level-headed but no less close to violence. Marrick and Locke are both at the entrance to the inner grove and the sacred pool and have just been denied entry.

13.speaker: Locke
13.text: The road to Baldur's Gate looks a little less daunting now that we're all back together.
13.context: NodeContext: Sincere and filled with love as you think of your family. You feel you can take on the world with them by your side.

29.speaker: Komira
29.text: We need to get Arabella out. Now.
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to husbandNodeContext: Your daughter is trapped inside with a bunch of druids who hate her. You're scared for her and instead of crying - you're angry. Snapping at your husband.

47.speaker: Locke
47.text: You heard the guards - they're waiting on Kagha to give word.
47.context: NodeContext: You know your wife is angry because she's scared for your daughter. Trying to calm the situation.

12.speaker: Komira
12.text: I'd sooner trek through the Nine Hells than trust that snake. Argh.
12.context: NodeContext: Utter hatred in your voice at the mention of 'that snake'. Kagha. The woman who took your daughter.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: I saw what happened. Why are the druids holding your daughter?

96.speaker: Locke
96.text: Arabella tried to steal their idol. Druids lost their damn minds about it - they need it for their precious ritual.
96.context: NodeContext: Sighing in frustration - you don't agree with your daughter did but the druids have MASSIVELY blown it out of proportion. Arabella was just trying to help.

68.speaker: Locke
68.text: It's our daughter. Kagha locked her up for stealing the idol - they need it for their precious ritual.
68.context: NodeContext: Sighing in frustration - you don't agree with your daughter did but the druids have MASSIVELY blown it out of proportion. Arabella was just trying to help.

92.speaker: Komira
92.text: It's all my fault. I told her I wished the wretched thing would just disappear - or better yet, explode.
92.context: NodeContext: Blaming yourself - even though it's not your fault. Very critical.

40.speaker: Locke
40.text: Now Arabella is being judged by a bunch of druids who hate us. That's not right.
40.context: NodeContext: You're terrified for you daughter. She

82.speaker: Lae'zel
82.text: She was caught? Foolish child - let them judge her.

69.speaker: Shadowheart
69.text: Sounds like she made the fatal mistake of getting caught. We shouldn't get involved.

87.speaker: Karlach
87.text: Poor thing must be terrified. Who do they think they are, keeping her away from her folks?

4.speaker: Astarion
4.text: Breaking into druid chambers to steal a sacred relic? Oh, she sounds like fun.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: She's just a child - the druids are overreacting. I'll talk to them.

43.speaker: Locke
43.text: Thank you. They won't give us the time of day.

64.speaker: Komira
64.text: Hurry. I'm at the end of my tether as is - can't take this waiting.
64.context: NodeContext: You're getting annoyed because it's easier than what you really feel - terrified for your daughter.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: You've got your work cut out for you.

73.speaker: Locke
73.text: We'll figure something out. We always do.
73.context: NodeContext: Firm and determined - you'll save your family. You always do.

23.speaker: Komira
23.text: Speaking of - we don't have time to gabber. You'd best move on.
23.context: NodeContext: Dismissive tone - gesturing for the player to leave.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: Like you said - it's your fault. You should've tried parenting her.

27.speaker: Komira
27.text: And you should bugger off. Now.
27.context: NodeContext: No nonsense tone - frustrated that the player has wasted your time.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Thieves deserve to be punished. It's as simple as that.

58.speaker: Komira
58.context: NodeContext: Rolling your eyes as you wave dismissively at the player. Someone else who thinks tieflings are thieves.

35.speaker: Wyll
35.text: Horrifying. We should check on the girl.

81.speaker: Gale
81.text: This grove is like a cauldron about to boil over. I say we check in on the child - make sure she comes to no harm.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: You need to be careful. That bear would've torn you to shreds.

59.speaker: Komira
59.text: I don't give a mrag about me. It's my daughter I'm worried about.
59.context: NodeContext: Sharp tongued and passionate - you'd cut your own throat if it meant keeping yoru daughter safe,

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Snake? You must really dislike Kagha.

97.speaker: Komira
97.text: Damn right I do. She locked up our daughter.
97.context: NodeContext: Venom in your voice at the mention of Kagha - you HATE her.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Snake? You must really dislike this Kagha.

34.speaker: Komira
34.text: How long is Kagha gonna take?
34.context: NodeContext: Frustrated - turning and looking around as if you'll see your daughter any moment. Something feels off, but you can't put your finger on it. (it transpires that the player lied - your daughter won't be released by Kagha, as Kagha murdered her.)

25.speaker: Locke
25.text: She'll release Arabella soon. I'm sure.
25.context: NodeContext: You see your wife's temper rising and you're trying to calm the situation. You know she's just worried for your daughter.

36.speaker: Komira
36.text: I'll rush the guards. You sprint past.
36.context: NodeContext: Thinking of ways to get to your little girl - who is trapped inside. You don't care what happens to you - you just want to make sure your daughter is safe.

65.speaker: Locke
65.text: I won't risk you too, love. We'll find another way.
65.context: NodeContext: You see the cogs turning in your wife's mind - you know she'll throw her life away to get to Arabella. You're trying to make sure both your wife and daughter survive the day.

37.speaker: Komira
37.text: Unless you have news of Arabella I don't want to hear it.
37.context: NodeContext: You still don't know if your daughter is okay. Tense and irritated - snapping a little though you don't mean to. You're just worried.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: She was bitten by a snake. It happened quickly. She felt no pain.

61.speaker: Komira
61.context: NodeContext: Player has just said your daughter was bitten by a snake - you don't follow. Mainly shocked and confused.

26.speaker: Locke
26.context: NodeContext: Stepping forward - asking for clairifcation. Scared at what the player will say - could you daughter be hurt? sick? what happened to her?

7.speaker: Locke
7.context: NodeContext: Player has just said your daughter is dead. You're shell shocked - barely taking in the world around you.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Arabella is gone. I'm sorry for your loss.

52.speaker: Komira
52.text: Don't be ridiculous. What are you on about?
52.context: NodeContext: You've heard the words - your daughter is dead, but you don't believe. Snapping at the player - surely this is all a misunderstanding?

39.speaker: Player
39.text: It was an accident. I wish it weren't true.

31.speaker: Komira
31.text: No. You're not saying? You're wrong. You're wrong. Bells...
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: |collapses to the ground, crying alongside her husband|NodeContext: you've just learned you child is dead - hysterical grieving

70.speaker: Player
70.text: Believe me or don't. It won't bring your daughter back.

8.speaker: Komira
8.context: NodeContext: Starting to get upset - you thought the player just said Arabella wasn't all right, but surely that can't be true. Turning to your husband, your rock.

46.speaker: Locke
46.context: NodeContext: Looking to the player - trying to be firm and strong even as you get upset yourself.

24.speaker: Komira
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: collapses to the ground, crying alongside her husband|NodeContext: you've just learned you child is dead - hysterical grieving as you collapse - calling out for your husband.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: I've involved myself too much already. No more.

9.speaker: Komira
9.context: NodeContext: Utterly furious - you feel the player has been yanking your chain and you're done with it. Snapping at them.

19.speaker: Komira
19.text: Are you having a laugh? Is this funny to you?
19.context: NodeContext: Aggresive - getting up in the player's face. The player has been yanking your chain and you're done with it.

54.speaker: Locke
54.text: Enough. No point mislaying our trust. We'll get Bells back on our own.
54.context: NodeContext: To your wife - knowing she's about to throw a punch and trying to calm the situation

95.speaker: Komira
95.context: CinematicNodeContext: As she walks awayNodeContext: Angrily mutter to yourself

53.speaker: Locke
53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to playerNodeContext: Dry and sarcastic

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Nothing - bad joke. Arabella's fine. Kagha will release her soon.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Tyr will not let this injustice go unpunished.

60.speaker: Komira
60.context: NodeContext: Starting to get upset - you thought the player just said Arabella wasn't all right, but surely that can't be true. Turning to your husband, your rock.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: She is cradled in the Moonmaiden's embrace now.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Ilmater ensured she was in no pain. She left this world in peace.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Kelemvor has taken her by the hand and guided her to the afterlife. She is safe now.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: That trial was a farce. Moradin will ensure her death does not go unpunished.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: I will pray to Glittergold. He will watch over her - and her soul will be filled with peace and laughter.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Little is more important than family. Yondalla will watch over your daughter - I promise.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Truth is better than ignorance - no matter how dark it may be. Your child is gone.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Under Helm's gaze I saw it. I don't believe Kagha meant to kill the child.

85.speaker: Locke
85.context: NodeContext: Starting to get upset - you thought the player just said Arabella wasn't all right, but surely that can't be true. Turning to your husband, your rock.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: Do not weep for your loss - wrest control of this place from the druids. Kill them for what they have done.

28.speaker: Locke
28.text: Loss? What are you on about?
28.context: NodeContext: Player has just said they are sorry for your loss, but what are they talking about? Surely it's not your daughter. She's fine - she has to be!

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Your daughter should have slain the snake - instead she fell to its venom.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: This is none of my concern.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Kagha will release her soon, just hold on.

63.speaker: Komira
63.context: NodeContext: Player has just said your daughter will be released 'soon'. Snapping and frustrated. You need to see here and you're terrified for her.

74.speaker: Locke
74.text: Hang on, love. This'll be over soon enough - we just gotta wait a bit longer.
74.context: NodeContext: You see your wife's temper rising and you're trying to calm the situation. You know she's just worried for your daughter.

71.speaker: Locke
71.text: Thank you. Sincerely. I don't know what we'd do without our little girl.
71.context: NodeContext: Turning to the player - love and gratitude in your voice.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Kagha killed your daughter. She called her a 'parasite' and a 'threat'.

50.speaker: Locke
50.context: NodeContext: Player has just brutally said that your daughter was called a parasite right before she was murdered. You're entire world collapses. You can't even see the player in front of you - everything centres around one thing. Your child is dead.

20.speaker: Komira
20.context: NodeContext: Screaming in near incomprehensible words. Hysterical grieving as you turn to your husband

16.speaker: Komira
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: collapses to the ground, crying alongside her husband|NodeContext: Screaming in near incomprehensible words. Hysterical grieving as you turn to your husband

38.speaker: Komira
38.context: NodeContext: Near screaming in grief - your daughter is dead and the player is trying to speak to you.

51.speaker: Locke
51.text: Arabella has behaved herself - so far. A miracle in itself. Thank you again.
51.context: NodeContext: Sincere and filled with love as you think of your family. You feel you can take on the world with them by your side.

93.speaker: Komira
93.text: Unless you have news of Arabella I don't want to hear it.
93.context: NodeContext: You still don't know if your daughter is okay. Tense and irritated - snapping a little though you don't mean to. You're just worried.

91.speaker: Locke
91.text: Please - she's been in there too long. It's not safe.
91.context: NodeContext: Trying not to beg but you're definitely pleading. Your little girl is all alone and you're terrified for her.
